p: Plant nomenclature, family and life history (e.g., annual, biennial, drought resistance, fire tolerance and invasive) followed the U.S.D.A. Plant Database ( http://plants.usda.gov/java/) [ 58]. U.S.D.A defines drought resistance and fire resistance as none, low, medium, and high. Drought resistance is based on where species grow relative to soil moisture, and fire resistance is based on regrowth and reestablishment after fire ( https://plants.usda.gov › charinfo) [ 58]. We assigned values of 3, 2, 1 or 0 to the U.S.D.A indices (respectively, none, low, medium, and high), and computed average drought and fire resistance for the plant community (Σ[U.S.D.A’s species drought tolerance or fire resistance index X species proportion]).
